|action2=FAC |action2date=10:01, 19 November 2013 |action2link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Melbourne Castle/archive1 |action2result=promoted |action2oldid=582164010 |currentstatus=FA }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Military history |class=FA |list = |A-Class=pass |B-Class-1=no |B-Class-2=no |B-Class-3=no |B-Class-4=yes |B-Class-5=no |British-task-force=yes |Classical-task-force=no |Fortifications-task-force=yes |Medieval-task-force=yes }} {{WikiProject Derbyshire|class=FA|importance=mid|ibox=yes|photo=yes}} {{WikiProject England|class=FA|importance=mid}} }}
== Key information? ==
the addition of NHLE details has been removed from the infobox - why is this not considered to be worth including here? [[User:EdwardUK|EdwardUK]] ([[User talk:EdwardUK|talk]]) 17:26, 28 June 2016 (UTC) :[[MOS:INFOBOX]] gives some helpful guidance here. An infobox should selectively provide the reader with the most important highlights on an article. I don't think that in this case that includes the full details of their NHLE - does the average reader really care about what date they were put on the register, for example? Other than the legal government listing - which has to by law! - I've never seen a source bother highlighting these facts about this castle. [[User:Hchc2009|Hchc2009]] ([[User talk:Hchc2009|talk]]) 18:13, 28 June 2016 (UTC)
The dates may not be too significant, but I would have thought that the fact it's a scheduled monument is important, and the infobox seems an appropriate place to highlight this (even if without all the details of the listing) - as well as proving a reference to a website with a good architectural history of the castle. - Would it be reasonable to include just the designation type and number as I think this would enhance the article [[User:EdwardUK|EdwardUK]] ([[User talk:EdwardUK|talk]]) 18:38, 28 June 2016 (UTC) :Its classification in UK conservation law doesn't seem to be a fact that other websites or books pull out as being prominent, and if we were looking for additional relevant facts about the castle to highlight to a busy reader, surely there have to be better ones? [[User:Hchc2009|Hchc2009]] ([[User talk:Hchc2009|talk]]) 19:19, 28 June 2016 (UTC)
:I accept that most sources focus on the history of the site rather than its present status, and maybe facts about this could be added as well/instead - currently the data in the infobox seems very limited - and as a quick reference doesn't provide very much information - I am aware that the infobox should be complimentary rather than a distraction from the main text, but think adding more facts (whether they be on events/battles or conservation) would be helpful to readers - and it would be possible to reduce the size of the map to compensate for any changes - [[User:EdwardUK|EdwardUK]] ([[User talk:EdwardUK|talk]]) 23:21, 28 June 2016 (UTC)
